  16. /* POSIX thread implementation of the user facing Mutex and Condition */
  17. /* To be included in runtime/sync.c */

  19. #ifndef CAML_SYNC_POSIX_H
  20. ‌#define CAML_SYNC_POSIX_H

  22. #include <errno.h>
  23. #include <pthread.h>
  24. #include <string.h>

  26. ‌typedef int sync_retcode;

  28. /* Mutexes */

  30. /* Already defined in <caml/sync.h> */
  31. /* typedef pthread_mutex_t * sync_mutex; */
  32. /* #define Mutex_val(v) (* ((sync_mutex *) Data_custom_val(v))) */

  34. ‌Caml_inline int sync_mutex_create(sync_mutex * res)
  35. {
  36.   int rc;
  37.   pthread_mutexattr_t attr;
  38.   sync_mutex m;

  40.   rc = pthread_mutexattr_init(&attr);
  41.   if (rc != 0) goto error1;
  42.   rc = pthread_mutexattr_settype(&attr, PTHREAD_MUTEX_ERRORCHECK);
  43.   if (rc != 0) goto error2;
  44.   m = caml_stat_alloc_noexc(sizeof(pthread_mutex_t));
  45.   if (m == NULL) { rc = ENOMEM; goto error2; }
  46.   rc = pthread_mutex_init(m, &attr);
  47.   if (rc != 0) goto error3;
  48.   pthread_mutexattr_destroy(&attr);
  49.   *res = m;
  50.   return 0;
  51. error3:
  52.   caml_stat_free(m);
  53. error2:
  54.   pthread_mutexattr_destroy(&attr);
  55. error1:
  56.   return rc;
  57. }

  59. ‌Caml_inline int sync_mutex_destroy(sync_mutex m)
  60. {
  61.   int rc;
  62.   rc = pthread_mutex_destroy(m);
  63.   caml_stat_free(m);
  64.   return rc;
  65. }

  67. ‌Caml_inline int sync_mutex_lock(sync_mutex m)
  68. {
  69.   return pthread_mutex_lock(m);
  70. }

  72. ‌#define MUTEX_PREVIOUSLY_UNLOCKED 0
  73. ‌#define MUTEX_ALREADY_LOCKED EBUSY

  75. ‌Caml_inline int sync_mutex_trylock(sync_mutex m)
  76. {
  77.   return pthread_mutex_trylock(m);
  78. }

  80. ‌Caml_inline int sync_mutex_unlock(sync_mutex m)
  81. {
  82.   return pthread_mutex_unlock(m);
  83. }

  85. /* Condition variables */

  87. ‌typedef pthread_cond_t * sync_condvar;

  89. ‌#define Condition_val(v) (* (sync_condvar *) Data_custom_val(v))

  91. ‌Caml_inline int sync_condvar_create(sync_condvar * res)
  92. {
  93.   int rc;
  94.   sync_condvar c = caml_stat_alloc_noexc(sizeof(pthread_cond_t));
  95.   if (c == NULL) return ENOMEM;
  96.   rc = pthread_cond_init(c, NULL);
  97.   if (rc != 0) { caml_stat_free(c); return rc; }
  98.   *res = c;
  99.   return 0;
  100. }

  102. ‌Caml_inline int sync_condvar_destroy(sync_condvar c)
  103. {
  104.   int rc;
  105.   rc = pthread_cond_destroy(c);
  106.   caml_stat_free(c);
  107.   return rc;
  108. }

  110. ‌Caml_inline int sync_condvar_signal(sync_condvar c)
  111. {
  112. return pthread_cond_signal(c);
  113. }

  115. ‌Caml_inline int sync_condvar_broadcast(sync_condvar c)
  116. {
  117.     return pthread_cond_broadcast(c);
  118. }

  120. ‌Caml_inline int sync_condvar_wait(sync_condvar c, sync_mutex m)
  121. {
  122.   return pthread_cond_wait(c, m);
  123. }

  125. /* Reporting errors */

  127. ‌static void sync_check_error(int retcode, char * msg)
  128. {
  129.   char * err;
  130.   char buf[1024];
  131.   int errlen, msglen;
  132.   value str;

  134.   if (retcode == 0) return;
  135.   if (retcode == ENOMEM) caml_raise_out_of_memory();
  136.   err = caml_strerror(retcode, buf, sizeof(buf));
  137.   msglen = strlen(msg);
  138.   errlen = strlen(err);
  139.   str = caml_alloc_string(msglen + 2 + errlen);
  140.   memcpy (&Byte(str, 0), msg, msglen);
  141.   memcpy (&Byte(str, msglen), ": ", 2);
  142.   memcpy (&Byte(str, msglen + 2), err, errlen);
  143.   caml_raise_sys_error(str);
  144. }

  146. #endif /* CAML_SYNC_POSIX_H */
